v3QxJh98cDE104sVEHXllA.text: I love this place. I've been going here since I was a kid and love the 20s/30s decor at the Gandy. I'm not fancy enough for the GC so this is a nice medium for me. Their clam chowder is gold standard, their sandwiches are yums, and the atmosphere is classic. The servers/kitchen staff is always pleasant and helpful. On sundays they have the legendary donut robot cranking out delicious fried treats for all the boys and girls... donuts don't get fresher than this.

9Tm4-X-8nl63tDUGfyJnEw.text: I met friends for happy hour. The service was good. My cocktail was fine.  The mini lobster roll was the worst I've ever had. It didn't even resemble lobster rolls I've had before. I've eaten them in a small town in Maine, in Boston, and Philadelphia. The bread is a thin delivery system for a filling with large chunks of lobster lightly coated in a tasty sauce. By volume, it's at least 80% lobster and white in color, because lobster meat is mostly white.  I expected it to be small, but the bread was actually the largest I've ever seen. The filling was a thin -- perhaps 1/4 inch? -- smear. It was pink. Any  lobster present was barely visible as tiny flakes. The dominant element was dry, flavorless bread.  I was hungry after work, and didn't want to make any fuss and spoil my friends' fun, so I ate it, but I was appalled.  It was served with thin white things that I didn't recognize at first, but figured out that they were onion rings. I expect onion rings to be crisp and golden brown. I tried one. It was limp, flavorless, and greasy. I wasn't hungry enough to eat them them.  I've never eaten at the Grand Concourse, and after seeing what they serve as bar food, I'm not inclined to take a risk on an expensive meal.

Ln0ORNDlf5PsqN2j_CdJgA.text: This is a very difficult review for me. I've been an enthusiastic, boastful, bragging regular customer of The Gandy Dancer for many, many years.. Great food, great drinks and the ambience; can't find better. I was very excited to take my partner for drinks and dinner tonite before the Riverhounds Soccer game. Wow! What a disappointment!  Sparse crowd, but less restaurants (Joe's Crab Shack, Hard Rock, etc) had a 35-40 minute wait? Our waitress wasn't the best, very loopy, spacey, wasn't sure about the menu. She forgot parts of our order; the order was wrong, and we asked for water several times. She probably could be better (efficient??) with more training? But she's not working at McDonalds? My partner ordered the fried fish dinner; very tasty. I ordered salad, with no onions, and honey mustard dressing and the scallop appetizer. I recd salad with sliced onions and house dressing? I Didn't return, because I didn't want to wait. But the "Dynamite scallop" appetizer was the biggest disappointment! 5 1/2 shell; scallops crab encrusted; basil drizzle.  But I recd 5 1/2 shells with 2 dime size scallops( maybe smaller) on 3 shells and 1 tiny scallop on 2 shells. I had to re look at the menu questioning "crab encrusted" that didn't exist?  Placed on black paper with shredded "something" in the middle? So sad; this was my go to place for friends, family, and anyone asking where to eat? Management needs to be more on top of what is going on. No complaints about the bartenders-great!  Tourists with children want a place to eat; not a kid friendly menu? Will I return, absolutely, it's a Pittsburgh tradition, but will question the quality of the food. Now, too many other restaurant choices.

beTMfMxxmByoavaz9-ckmw.text: We have been a couple of times for happy hour. The first time was ok,the second time we witnessed the bar tender stirring a drink that he was about to serve,WITH HIS FINGER!

KXd_bSZ_GHRnt9f3_NPzAg.text: Horrible service! We went in for drinks and were treated badly because we didn't want to order a meal. Management even came and spoke to us because we had cups of water with us that didn't come from that place.

bFm_ZVT01Nnmc-NBx6Bfcw.text: This has to be our favorite bar in Pittsburgh.  We love the old world atmosphere and the decor.  We enjoy sitting at the bar having a drink made by the well trained bartenders and just taking in the ambiance.  There's just something about it and  it just feels right to us.  This is the place that we choose to go when we feel like celebrating something or if we are meeting up with friends or if we just need to have a relaxing time on a Saturday afternoon.  We even spent this past New Year's Eve with them....what a wonderful time that was!!  We are planning to do it again!  It is always perfectly relaxing and enjoyable.  There's never a bad time to go to the Gandy Dancer!   Many years ago, the bartender introduced me to what is now my all time favorite cocktail--a Hendricks Gin Martini with a cucumber.  This is the place to get one for sure!  The prices might be a bit steep but if you hit it for happy hour--you can save some $$...they have a great Happy Hour.  As for food----you can't go wrong with the Charley's Chowder!  That's all I ever order when I go because I have loved it since the day they opened...way back when!!!   But, I've often picked off my husband's plate and I can vouch for almost all of their seafood entrees!   As time goes on, I find that we choose places for the experience more than the food.  You can get  good food at hundreds of places but not every place has the experience of the Gandy Dancer.  Why did I take me so long to write a review???  Now that I have, I have to plan another trip.  This weekend?  Yes!!!

3qjT2OMRkCi0GG_WczuyZg.text: New trendy places come and go but there is a reason the Gandy Dancer in the Grand Concourse has been around and become a Pittsburgh institution. The decor and professional and friendly bartenders take you back to a time when people had pride in what they did.  They have a great happy hour for both food and drinks. Not only does the bar have their own menu you can also order from the Grand Course menu as well. They bring in fresh oysters from different locations and one of the days they have a $1 oyster special. However this last trip I went for the sliders with blue cheese.  They were decent and the caramelized onions and blue cheese really made the burgers. Can't wait to go back.

C-FUOoOzO-6aWjzFq0-Bfw.text: A business colleague chose Gandy Dancer for our lunch meeting. He is a regular customer. The restaurant was not busy on a Monday. But service was lackadaisical at best, waitress was AWOL for long periods. Salad course came. Ehh but ok. Entrees took.effing.for.ever. asked about it twice. Others joined us for coffee but our entrees still hadn't arrived. Finally they came. My 'pan seared scallops' were in a pond of pinkish thin sauce and were nowhere near being seared. Poached and tasteless. Coffee was served lukewarm. Rather than offer a fresh hot brew, our waitress offered to take it and warm it up. Amateur hour in the kitchen and on the floor. My host, their regular customer, was embarrassed. Chuck Meur restaurants used to be terrific. This one has sadly declined.

HGxSsOtkMsTj69TUzPxM-A.text: I visited the Gandy Dancer for the first time yesterday evening and I have a WONDERFUL experience. The restaurant is gorgeous, and the food lives up to the building it is housed in. I ate on the bar side of the restaurant, and the prices were VERY reasonable for the wonderful quality of a meal that I received. I'm not sure if the restaurant side is more expensive (that's what I thought I over heard.) The chef who served us was extremely personable, kind, knowledgeable, and just made the whole experience pleasant. I can't wait to pass this restaurant on to friends!

HGTi_HySrhyuafPUivDBhA.text: The service was good, but the food and drinks left a lot to be desired.  Mint in my sangria was black from sitting out, the drink itself was very weak and mostly ice.  The crab was very wet and tasteless (from a can?), and they sit it on top of breaded fish which ruins the breading.  Maybe the lunch menu is better.

4U1SLGpHJsOmo5gCG6DLkQ.text: I really don't enjoy leaving bad reviews, so when I do, it is only after a True disappointment. We came in and decided on the casual saloon instead of the attached Grand Concourse. A woman came breezing by, noticed we were there, and grabbed the menus. Several minutes later, we ordered our drinks and appetizers.  After maybe 10 minutes, another young lady walked up. She mentioned that she had our drinks in and they should be up shortly. We realized that this woman was now our waitress, although it was never communicated to us... It was about her third time over that she actually introduced herself.  We got our drinks, and after another 15 minutes or so, we mentioned our appetizers. I got the impression that the order wasn't communicated very well from waitress to waitress. We got a bread basket for the table in the meantime, because we went hungry and had now been waiting about a half hour for any sign of food. When the bread came, we ordered our meals immediately before the waitress disappeared again. After the appetizers (shrimp dumplings for me, which tasted like they were from a P.F. Chang grocery freezer section box, and a mini surf and turf for her), I got up to look around. We thought that maybe this poor girl had to wait both the saloon and the dining hall, perhaps they were understaffed? It was a Monday night though, and not especially busy.  As I passed back through, I noticed two meals that looked an awful lot like what we ordered sitting and waiting to be picked up. I tried to tell myself that maybe some other table had just ordered the same exact thing (how funny, right?) We still hadn't received our side salads. I mentioned this to our waitress, when she finally magically reappeared, and she looked confused -"Umm, sure, let me go check on that for you..." Now you see her, Now you don't. 10-15 minutes elapsed, and I went to the restroom to check my lipstick... There were our meals, still just sitting there.  The second she brought the salads, my bold and livid friend said "Are those our meals sitting out there?"  She looked a little bit flustered. "I'm not sure. I haven't checked yet."  You know, the saddest part is, besides the shrimp dumplings, all of our food was very good. Just a bit, you know, cold. I got the Salmon of the Angels (salmon medallions over angel hair pasta with a creamy basil tomato sauce) and really enjoyed it. And the drink I got, the Apple Pie Mule, is something I would actually go back for. Maybe if I went again, it would be for drinks at the bar.

uCnmHGH0pndR5PsCj4r8tg.text: Have been here before for happy hour and it was fabulous. This past time the service was beyond poor. Waiter was not only incompetent but rude. All our food was cold and he forgot several things.

gHmAMViYHIAcRgLCmmVcng.text: The Gandy Dancer is one of my parent's favorite places to eat (and drink) in Pittsburgh. It was no surprise to me when my mom said this is where she wanted to celebrate her birthday this past weekend. This place is an oldie but goodie!   We went around 2:00 in the afternoon and sat at the bar.. being that it was such an odd time there were only about 2 other parties inside other than my parents & I. I started with my favorite cocktail.. a cosmopolitan. I will say that this is the best Cosmo I have had recently (if not ever)! It is served in a chilled martini glass and the drink is poured to perfection. My parents both got martinis as well, my mom loves their Hendricks's gin martini & my dad gets dirty martinis. They both loved every sip as well!   I started with their soup of the day which was wedding soup. It was great for a cold afternoon! My only complaint was that it was just a little too salty, but it was still good! The bartender gave us a menu for the Grand Concourse and told us we were welcome to order anything off that menu for lunch in addition to what is on the Gandy Dancer's menu. I ended up ordering the Island Fish tacos from GC's menu. These were fabulous! I loved the mango salsa on these- it gave them the perfect amount of sweetness mixed with hot flavors from the dynamite sauce. My mom got her favorite soup the Charley's Chowder & my dad got the diner burger & they enjoyed their meals as well. If you are looking for a classic bar with great service, great food, and even greater cocktails than check out the Gandy Dancer!

JuKVvvLhxO4I237nnuGHHw.text: Came for buck a shuck on Thursday and also ordered off the happy hour menu. It is a phenomenal venue with great hospitality. Oysters were tasty and the craft beer selection kept us happy. A must try in PixBurgh!

KdhoAHqrBzrkiWNHIP_1uQ.text: Located in the, well, grand Grand Concourse building, right next to the restaurant, Gandy Dancer puts on a killer Happy Hour every weeknight.  There are drink as well as food specials.  My husband and I stopped by on Friday the 13th prior to our Grand Concourse dinner reservations next door, and what a great decision that was!  As can be expected, the $5 glasses of wine during Happy Hour were more than twice the price in the restaurant.  We gobbled up an order of the craft beer battered cod (light and flakey and served with thick rich tartar sauce; couldn't have been better), the raw oysters (all 3 were nice and mild, just the way I like them), and the white flatbread (a nice cracker-thin crust).  That, a few glasses of wine, and we were off to our dinner reservations next door.  I have to say, all things considered and bang for buck, Gandy Dancer stands right up to Grand Concourse.  Service was great, efficient.  We snagged the last open table in the jovial bar area, and our server was on top of everything.  The food and refills came out quickly despite Happy Hour being in full swing.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Oysters (Happy Hour)

8SZv4wnKOIcar8is73NjyA.text: Today it was my husband's turn to pick where we ate. He chose The Gandy Dancer. We had not been there in over 20 years. It is in an older historical building at Station Square. When you go in it's like walking back in time. It has all of the original dark woodwork. There are pictures of Pittsburgh dated in the early 1900s. The lighting is low and on a hot day like today it was a great setting for lunch.  Our server was Colin. He gave us the BEST customer service we've had in a long time.  My husband ordered the jambalaya. It came with a salad. I shared the salad with him and it was really good. It had romaine lettuce, purple onions, tomatoes, and cucumbers. It was dressed with a balsamic dressing. It was very fresh and very tasty. I didn't try my husband's jambalaya but he cleaned his plate. It had huge shrimp, scallops, mussels, and salmon. It looked wonderful but I'm a wimp when it comes to spiciness so I chose not to try it.  I had the Blue Crab Club sandwich. It had crab, tomatoes, bacon,  lettuce, and Boursin. I asked that they leave the tomatoes off. It came with fries and coleslaw. The sandwich was very good. The crunch of the lettuce and the toast went well with the creaminess of the crab. The coleslaw was a little different than most. It had cabbage and carrots but it also had green peppers. I'm not sure what they used for dressing but it wasn't mayo or vinegar. The French fries were cooked perfectly.  I asked to see their dessert menu. Colin said all of the desserts were made on site. The Key Lime pie was tempting but I went for the Mango Sorbet. It was smooth and a perfect summer dessert. It came with a couple of raspberries and a pirouette cookie. My husband was only going to have a taste but couldn't stop at one spoonful.  We definitely won't wait another 20 years to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Outdoor seating
Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mango Sorbet
Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Jumbalya

hISGsKlVxviAglvhuc91fQ.text: Amazing atmosphere, but the food leaves less to be desired. Connected to grand concourse. Similar menus but food quality is night and day of difference. Been here twice and both times we left hungry. 6 different menu items, all way too salty and over cooked. The mango mojito was the tastiest thing there. Service; very clustered.

NQ1n9rlWprS5oiWtQjHSkQ.text: Definitely a Pittsburgh staple. The decor is of another era; it's like stepping back in time. Drink prices are as expected.

1giRgvZ-TOhEnrvVEquqcg.text: Our first time there and we loved it!  Besides the great food, it was more because of the super friendly service by Kelly at the bar.  She was very busy, but always managed to strike up a conversation and keep our glasses full.  Easily the most friendly restaurant in Pittsburg and you can tell the employees genuinely like working there.  Highly recommend the duck and butternut squash bisque (with a touch of cracked pepper).

dCUIDi39JiET76uCywBubA.text: This is a really cool place, right near the river. Gotta check out the huge ball room, which I guess used to be the train depot? Too cool.  Decent burger, good beer selection. I have my first Yeungling's here.

fYyjDq4iXQ1v3h1RXT1neQ.text: Lunch here was made pleasant by our waitress Melissa. Food - meh. I had the salad with shrimp and crab. Shrimp were good. Crab had a dressing I did not care for. The greens were mixed in that some were fresh and others were slimy. My husband had fish and chips and the fish tasted very fishy which is not a good sign.

70_fVXgYlHas0UBpuHya9Q.text: Wonderful atmosphere, classy, without being overdone. Properly dressed waiters and beautiful bar. Has a great ambience.  Occasionally I enjoy a simple wine spritzer done the right way - dry white wine with some sparkling water on the side so I can blend the two. Our server immediately understood and brought exactly what I asked for (no ice in the wine, no lemon garnish, or other gimmick).  The food was superb, our party had the white sauce linguine, salmon angel hair pasta, raw oysters, oyster rockefeller, and prime rib. Simple, done the right way, without any extra nonsense.   Very solid restaurant.

NxbwWTyXwGsW3WwNS2YPVA.text: I had an interesting experience here with my group of friend the other night.  There were 7 of us, which is a bigger group.  Our server was super nice, but a bit odd.  He had a hard time keeping everything straight and seemed really overwhelmed.   We all ordered wine, which was over priced!  We also got a few things to snack on.  The food was fine, but nothing special.  I will not be running back here anytime soon.

krrD8ZcBr-kDx8q_YokE_g.text: Fish and chips had strange almond extract and tasted like marzipan. Waitress rushed us.   When I asked what special soup and sandwich was she said she didn't know.  My mother in law ordered pasta and the bowl was so full of liquid it was like soup, and they don't give you any bread with it.

tNrpAzz5IBNyMCC31N0MGw.text: Happy hour is 430-7. There is a $6 Bleu cheese slider app - you get two of them. Someday, I'm going to get 4 orders and tell them to just keep them coming. Good jambalaya, too.

8heQFtrmFvtWOfq5ye0OcQ.text: Ok.  Now let's not fool ourselves. This is the bar to the Grand Concourse. Same kitchen. Same management. Same awesomeness. Now as for the menu differences.   When dining in the bar one can order from the Grand Concourse menu and Gandy Dancer menu, which in my opinion makes this the best place to eat. That combined with the ridiculously inexpensive happy hour prices just makes it an excellent spot to grab a bite.  (Now keep in mind, when dining in the Grand Concourse, you can't order from the Gandy Dancer menu)   What to order... So many options, where to begin-   I'll start w Happy Hour bites. Yes, say yes to them. They're priced at a few dollars each and great for ordering a bunch with a group. I'm partial to the steamed dumplings. Yummy & inexpensive.   The bar menu.  What I love about the bar menu is that it's fantastic to show up and order a hearty meal to warm you up in the cold months or a crisp light flavorful meal to refresh one in the summer.   To begin. The pasta is awesome. Made in house. My personal favorite is the artichoke, shrimp, and angel hair in a light tomato base. It seems to be close to or the same item that disappeared from the Grand Concourse menu. The pasta menu is great. So many options. Light sauces, hearty sauces, spicy, tortellini, so many choices.   My second favorite pasta dishes are a tie between the Cajon Chicken Tortellini and the Shrimp Fettuccine Verde. The Cajon Chicken Tortellini is served in a cream sauce with mushrooms. (And I say I hate mushrooms) It is really a fantastic mix of the right amount of Cajon mixed with the cream mushroom sauce and chicken & tortellini. A fantastic dance of spice and everything perfectly hits your taste buds Fettuccine is a very traditional dish that I typically am not a huge fan of. The Shrimp Fettuccini Verde is a Spinach fettuccine with goat cheese in a cream tomato sauce. It's different in a really good way that you must like goat cheese to enjoy.    I also love the Shrimp & Crab Salad. The crab is Lump Crab. I have it with tomatoes & cucumbers. It's a Greek style vinaigrette. Delicious. Great in the summer.   The Gandy House Salad is also very crisp & delicious. I order is customized without onion or pepperancini. It comes w fresh & sundries tomatoes along with cucumber in a vinaigrette. Another great start to a meal.   The bread served with dinner is delicious. Same as the Grand Concourse's. I hate salmon pate. It's a personal choice but my kid loves it. The bar tabled area is very kid friendly. We've taken Mr. Toddler since he was an nugget and they've always accommodated his needs. His favorite item at both locations is their pate. (It's also served during the Sunday Brunch.)   My family loves the oysters. Again, another thing I don't care for. They adore the Grand Concourse & Gandy Dancers Selection. They're the same.  I personally don't consume anything from their raw bar other than shrimp so I cant comment specifically on items. The family seems to love it. That's what I know.   The one item that my husband ordered and didn't love was the sirloin steak. He said he wouldn't get it again.  He said it was good but just not what he typically would order.

YDEcNngNbcfBvx5IEpX4BA.text: Beautiful location!! I ordered the Cajun chicken tortellini and another person in my party had the Italian dip sandwich. Both were fantastic! Very reasonable portions and the service was quick! The saloon is very casual, but attached to the Grand Concourse restaurant. Please be sure to walk in there and view the architecture and beautiful glass windows!! Will definitely return!

1_J14e1ZdvZoJmFFxE-5OA.text: Well not owned by MUER. Family anymore, but still have many many legacy items. Delicious and did not disappoint. Blue points, New England clam chowder and Martha vineyard salad for a late dinner

8qZDnwcqzUUpRdTBqCH88A.text: Fantastic as always!  Spicy, cucumber martini out of this world!  Had dinner here Saturday night for my 50th!  Love the location and the history of the building!

oDrVu8yauyrxygv0YOG1_A.text: Probably the best surprise about visiting Pittsburgh is the Gandy Dancer. It was so good the first time, we came back the next day. Kyle and Alexa were outstanding. A+ caliber service. The food was extraordinary. Happy Hour is exceptional. Great ambiance, great food, great staff. No negatives at all!!!  You have to try and enjoy!!!

5GmZWnDIXo8-WCkybaYBig.text: It has been years since we were here since we moved out of town, so it was nice to come back for old times sake.   It didn't  appear much had changed in the cosmetics.  We had the most unpleasant bartender I think I have ever encountered.   He approached us and never said Hello or anything.  He just kind of looked at us as if to say "what do you want".  We looked at each other thinking we were in the wrong place, because it used to be so nice here.   We ordered martinis and they were just ok.  Vodka wasn't cold enough and didn't fill the glass.   The bartender never ever said a word to us.  It was bizarre.  Prices weren't bad, which was surprising.     The place was dead on a Saturday night at 7:00.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

V0GY8xslN8duCU-zLMAIZA.text: As a lunch venue on a work day, the prices are decent but the service is way too slow. I work in Station Square so expect quick service but it seems they may be used to either slow business lunches or tourists. That said,  the iced tea and fish tacos were both excellent.

yYJmO8TDvEQ0GE9Yx4UjIA.text: We stopped in to the Gandy Dancer on 11/22/18 Thanksgiving day before visiting my family. I was born and raised in Pittsburgh and have always loved this place. We sat at the bar and since it was Thanksgiving the crowd was packed in the lobby waiting for the Thanksgiving buffet. We inquired about the price of the buffet which was $42!! The bar was quiet and we were waited on quickly and kindly by the bartender. I ordered a Pomegranate Martini and my companion ordered some type of bourbon. The Martini was excellent and so was the bourbon! I love the atmosphere here and would love to come back on a non holiday to try the food again. I definitely recommend the Gandy Dancer!

zqTbVrTXumIdYB8yIk8ZAA.text: I'm reviewing the happy hour - it's daily from 4:30-7 and it's awesome  Started with a pomegranate martini which was so delicious and packed a punch.  We went on a Thursday and they had a great special on oysters $1 a piece so of course we got a dozen.  They have a special happy hour menu which had a nice selection of items to nosh on- I would totally recommend the flatbread and the blue cheese sliders (they served 2 and were way bigger than what I thought they'd be AND they came with French fries!).  I would not get the mini lobster roll - too much bread and not enough lobster or filling.  The oysters were perfect!  This was not on the HH menu (it's on the regular dinner menu) but the fish tacos were really fresh and delicious and a great deal! Came with a bowl of black bean soup and a side of rice too all for $12.  The wines were $6 a glass and the cab was actually tasty!  Would definitely come again for the happy hour!  Josh, our server, was attentive and great.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Flat bread - $6 - wow so good
Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Blue cheese sliders - $6 - great deal and tasty!
Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Mini lobster roll - $7 - not worth it

dwM92ubHzKJUBLKGnEWmsw.text: This is another occasion where I wish Yelp gave the option to hand out 3.5 stars because this really was a 3.5 star experience. First, Gandy Dancer and Grand Concourse are basically in the same building and are somewhat connected. Even though I thought I was looking at the Gandy menu on Yelp, I was somehow actually looking at the Grand menu, and that's the menu where I found what I wanted. So, seeing that the negative ratings were primarily for the service rather than the food, I ventured into Gandy to grab the Blue Crab Club Sandwich. Again, I had thought it was on their menu. I sat at the bar, got a menu, and quickly realized it was different from online. No problem, the bartender (who had greeted me quickly) said I could order from either menu. Great! I ordered the club with fries, holding the tomato, and it came out soon thereafter. Maybe it's the lack of tomatoes that's the cause, but I had a lot of bread (three slices since it's a club), a lot of lettuce, a layer of bacon, and not much crab. Every bite's taste was pretty much bread, lettuce, mayo (a lot of mayo!), a hint of bacon, and an even more slight hint of crab. The crab tasted good from what I could gather. There just wasn't enough of it. I love mayo, don't get me wrong, but this had a lot of mayo. I was wiping my mouth (and face) with my napkin after every bite. Mayo lovers of Pittsburgh, rejoice! This is your mayo haven! The fries were fantastic. Crispy, but not overly crunchy, with good flavor. Service was consistent, but not fantastic. My tea glass sat mostly empty for a long time and was never refilled. At the point I put my credit card out, it sat there for awhile before the bartender noticed. Overall, good but not great, and worthy of a 3.5 star rating.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

B3MFbGKrX6yobzuhKQz5Zw.text: Good food, good drinks  Service was below average  And there was a little girl skipping around the bar area the whole time

jBAxVrwX9h0f3HMdW2BOtA.text: Discovered Thursday's are Buck-a-Shuck and enjoyed a dozen $1/oysters with the necessary fixin's. Enjoyed the happy hour drink and food specials as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

DZULWqA0LDC6UYg4ROf0Wg.text: This place has excellent food! The location is great. But the service at the Gander Dancer is absolutely terrible. Unless you sit at the oyster bar during the day, you will wait forever for someone to service your table. Then once you do have someone come over it's like they physically have to go and make the beer chill it and pour it in a glass and then bring it over. The service at the Gandy is the worse. It's a shame because the food once it finally does come out is amazing.

pq4y8Qs0CkiAug43Borbnw.text: I've had great experiences at Gandy Dancer - only really have been for happy hour, but each time it's enjoyable! The happy hour menu is perfect for me, a few staple food items for $3, $4, and $5 and several drink specials make it a tasty and affordable happy hour. The fries are delicious and always a go-to!  A friend did host a birthday party there and it was very nice to have a private area for everyone to gather and have a great night.  They also do have valet parking and I believe they still validate parking in the nearby lot, which always helpful when trying to coax people into coming to Station Square to meet up.

Qo8iFJQbpY-dMFtN0B2l4w.text: We started out at the bar with the chilled seafood sampler which was fresh ,crisp and delish!!Cold drinks were very affordable and the service was excellent! Alexis at the bar was very helpful and well informed. The 4 of us enjoyed our meals tremendously.  We got the seafood pot which was amazing. The wife got the vegetarian curry which was very flavorful.  The Shrimp ceasar salad was delish. Lots of thumbs up for this local spot at Station Square!

fhLpTziXLGmetERZxxYEhg.text: Cool atmosphere and vibe. Great feeling of historic Pittsburgh. The original floors, ceiling and train cars is awesome. We had cocktails and appetizers and everything was fresh and delicious. Will  definitely come back the next time we visit!

ydVD-9Yfe2AxUr0kTj5mFg.text: When I first approached the restaurant and saw the wait staff in black pants and button down white shirts, I was afraid I would be under dressed.  However, the rest of the customers seemed pretty casually dressed so I sat on the patio and ate lunch.  The service was good and the food was less pricey than I expected.  I ordered the special, which was a steak sandwich, for around $10 (and it came with fries).  My sister, however, ordered a shrimp caesar salad and they had not deveined the shrimp (you could see the little brown line of poop in it) which was offputting.  A great location right on the river and reasonable prices though!

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

tGh4oKFzUqmK7A894VyKrg.text: Good happy hour if you're in station square, but nothing special. Signature Drinks were overly sweet for our entire table... I got a spicy cucumber martini and it wasn't spicy and my hands ended up being sticky. Switched to wine and it was fine. Food was okay. The waitress hustled but our food and drinks came out slowly. It was a Wednesday evening so the place had very few patrons - not sure what took so long.

BcvV_H1RZEVG4Yad9E7rnw.text: How can you not like this place?  It's like the Godfather of Pittsburgh- so much history, so much character, so much delightful romance.  A visit to the Gandy Dancer always puts my wife in the mood...  ;)  In the mood to head home afterwards & cuddle.    We didn't know about the Thursday Oyster special ($1 each) so we came here on a Tuesday.  I had my heart set on oysters so I ordered a dozen (3 for $5).  They were fresh & meaty with just enough salt water to make them taste like the ocean.  I could have settled for a little less shell bits mixed in, but I guess that comes with the territory.  The issue we had was with their draft beer system.  The Coors Light smelled a bit sour & tasted a little bitter.  I think the lines needed cleaned.  Nancy offered to get us drafts from the other bar but they too tasted bitter.  We ended up drinking bottles.  I hope they have the lines cleaned before our next visit...

photos.caption: Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. HH menu posted on 1/7/2016
Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. HH menu posted on 1/7/2016
Photo of Gandy Dancer Saloon - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. HH menu posted on 1/7/2016

A32fo79cUc1hOn9LuYV8-g.text: Beautiful architecture.....great service.....great value.....awesome food (especially the Mediterranean seafood chowder and Blue crab club sandwich).  Highly recommend

PIJIOJJFdKMpwUXFrTxA-Q.text: I gave three stars because I believe it's probably better than was demonstrated tonight.  Service was kind of strange. I sat at the bar and the communication with the staff would have put me to sleep had it not been so early.  Boring is an understatement.  Recommendations were met with, it's ok or it depends....you have to say what it depends on!!!!   It was like pulling teeth.   The food was equally boring.   I had the seafood steamer pot.  It really lacked any flavor, but what upsets me is that 5 muscles never opened.  SO WHY PUT THEM ON MY PLATE???  The Charley's chowder was good, so no complaints with that.   I wanted to change wines and had to ask for the menu several times.    Let's hope next time I'm in town I realize this was not a typical night.

nEbDr4xPlYD7bwW8js_5yw.text: I had higher hopes for the Gandy Dancer based on recommendations by friends and unfortunately my experience this past Saturday night with 6 of my girlfriends fell extremely short.  We arrived around 8:30 and most tables were full, but it wasn't bustling and busy which was fine for us.  We sat ourselves and a waitress came over about 10 minutes later to take our drink orders.  She seemed new from the beginning, and I am not sure if she was just overwhelmed, but I have to say our service throughout the night was really poor.  It took quite a while for our 3 dirty martinis, 2 cosmos and 2 mango mojitos to arrive and we had to ask twice for ice waters.  The cosmos and mojitos were excellent. The dirty martinis, in addition to the glass only arriving half full, were hard to drink.  Just not very well made.  We placed our food orders and we were so into conversation amongst ourselves that I didn't realize how long it took, but we did have to keep asking for water & drink refills in the meantime.  I ordered the Charley's Chowder and their bruschetta and around the table, others got the crab stuffed mushrooms, Caesar salad, burger and fries, and salmon pasta.  Our food was good. Not anything great or amazing. Nothing that I would hurry back to get again.  It was standard and in my opinion, there are better places to get bar food in the Burgh.  The fries seemed to be frozen and the flatbread the bruschetta came with was just plain.  The soup was good, but I added salt.  The pasta was good from the bites I tried but again, just kind of average.  We ended up having a drink at the bar after dinner and by that time, the place was completely cleared out of anyone left.  Our bartender was extremely friendly and funny. They were cleaning up the restaurant while we waited for our Uber to the next location and she was fun to chat with before we took off.  It was just OK. I'd go back and give it another try, hopefully with better service. Not in any hurry, though.

KDQY8h4nz4BIoLE-lBQD2Q.text: We went with friends for an early dinner. Our waiter just did his job, take our order, refill our waters, delivered our order and brought the check. Food was fresh and tasty, although the shrimp/crabmeat salad was lacking crabmeat and the shrimp had the peel left on!!  The manger offered to bring a new salad but it was already half eaten. Did comp the dish. Never asked at the end of our meal if we were interested in coffee or dessert. Disappointed for a place like that. Will think twice before going back.

44H221bkcwtNGlipBcfuvw.text: Service is absolutely the worst. It took 10 mi items to be noticed. Then another 20 minutes to get a beverage. Food was decent. Staff was very unorganized.
